decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Excluding the details in relation to the window frames, the development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be completed in accordance with the following details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to above ground works.(a)	manufacturer(s) details to show the timber effect UPVC window frames (including their dimensions, colour and texture). Reason: In order that the architectural and historic interest of the Fairfield/Knights Park Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, additional detailed drawings and/or sectional plans at at Scale 1:5/1:10 showing the relationship between the window frames and the front elevation (the depth of reveals) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to above ground works.Reason:  In order that the architectural and historic interest of the Fairfield/Knights Park Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Conditions 3 (Materials) and 12 (Construction Management Plan) of planning permission 21/00068/FUL have been assessed by relevant consultants and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant must ensure that the Scaffolding licence and Temporary Traffic Management Order for suspension of the two indicated parking spaces is in place in advance of works starting. Prior to this they should contact the Highways traffic inspections team to arrange a highways condition survey and should note that they will be responsible for meeting fully the cost of repairing any damage to the highway resulting from these works.The applicant should also provide a copy of the CMP to RBK Highways Streetworks Team and comply with any requests that they may make.A banksman should be deployed to ensure that all deliveries take place in a safe manner and no delivery vehicles should be permitted to wait on Old London Road.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Condition 6 (Noise Insulation), Condition 10 (Waste and Recycling Facilities) and Condition 11 (Secure Cycle Parking) of planning permission 21/00068/FUL have been assessed by relevant consultants and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The fee required for your planning application is £116.00.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or online via the Kingston council website.

Please state exactly which Conditions are to be discharged as part of this application and what documentation has been provided to support discharge for each condition For example condition 11 (Lanscaping Scheme) cannot be discharged as part of this planning application, because the table submitted states: "This will be produced prior to occupation as required" (This is unnaceptable therefor Condition 11 would not be discharged as part of this application as a Landscape Scheme has not been provided.You must cleary state in writing which Conditions you wish to discharge and provide supporting documentation for each condition.Also documentation submitted to Building Control will have to be re-submitted to us at Planning to support discharge of any condition you aim to discharge as part of this Planning application
